data.title: A to Z Guide
data.meta_description: Las Vegas’ hottest new sports and entertainment venue, located just west of the famed Las Vegas Strip, will be officially named T-Mobile Arena.
data.text:
T-Mobile Arena has Accessible seating options on each level of the venue. This seating can be purchased online at www.tmobilearena.com or www.axs.com.

For the Accessibility Guide, please click here.

For safety, and as a courtesy to other guests, aisles must be kept clear at all times. Please follow the directions of the usher in your section to your assigned ticketed seat and refrain from standing in the aisles. Dancing, lingering, etc. in the aisles will not be allowed for the safety of all guests.

T-Mobile Arena and Levy Restaurants have adopted an alcohol policy that is designed to protect guests and the community from alcohol-related incidents. In addition to our responsible alcohol service guidelines below, T-Mobile Arena and Levy Restaurants offer a designated driver program at most events. Guests are expected to obey all state and local laws governing the purchase, possession, and consumption of alcohol. It is illegal for anyone under the age of 21 to consume alcoholic beverages. In addition, the following items are to be noted:

T-Mobile Arena does not allow outside food and beverage into the arena.

T-Mobile Arena reserves the right to deny entry to guests who appear to be impaired.

Alcoholic beverages will not be served in containers larger than 25 ounces.

There shall be a maximum limit of two alcoholic beverages sold to each guest, per transaction, with current, valid ID. At times, this may be adjusted per management.

All guests who appear to be younger than the age of thirty-five (35) will be asked to show current valid identification prior to being served alcoholic beverages. Acceptable forms of valid United States identification are: Driver's License, Passport, United States Passport Card, State Issued I.D. Card w/ Photo, Military I.D. w/ Photo, and Mexican Consular Card

T-Mobile Arena and Levy Restaurants have implemented an on-going responsible alcohol management T.E.A.M. (Techniques for Effective Alcohol Management) training sessions for serving staff.

T-Mobile Arena reserves the right to eject anyone under the age of twenty-one (21) who is observed to be in possession of, or consuming alcohol on the premises. These individuals may also be subject to the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department persecution.

Guests on the suite levels are prohibited from removing bottles, cans and/or glasses from the suite level.

Animals or pets of any kind are prohibited in T-Mobile Arena with the exception of trained service animals and service animals in training for guests with disabilities. Service animals are welcome inside the arena, but must remain on a leash or in a harness at all times. Service animals will rest in the seating area of the individual with a disability, rather than in the aisle. A guest whose service animal poses a threat to the safety of other guests and employees may be asked to escort the animal off the premises.

Located on Toshiba Plaza adjacent to Allegiant Stage. Pricing starts at $20 per checked bag which is non-refundable. Debit/credit and mobile payment, such as Apple or Google Pay, are acceptable forms of payment. No cash will be accepted. T-Mobile Arena has a “No Re-Entry” policy for all events and bags will not be accessible during the event. Bag check opens the same time as arena doors for each event and closes 45 minutes post-event. Bags remaining after bag check closes will be returned to Lost & Found.

The Bud Light Lounge, also known as Desert by Night, is located on the west side of the Main Concourse and accessible by Club Seat holders and all Suite Holders. Dates and times for access to the lounge are subject to availability and may vary based on the event happening at the arena.

chargeFUZE offers the largest network of mobile charging kiosks for users to rent portable chargers on the go. Download the chargeFUZE App to find your nearest kiosk.

1) Scan the QR code 2) Charge any device 3) Return to any station

For most events, children 24 months of age and under will not require a ticket for entry into T-Mobile Arena, however, they must occupy the seating area or lap of one (1) ticketed adult.

Please note, some events (family shows or those intended for children) will have a different child admissions policy and may require children under 24 months of age to have a ticket for entry.

City National Bank is a founding partner at T-Mobile Arena. They have provided five ATM’s for use during events.

Two are located on the Main Concourse. One, next to Guest Services at Section 13 and a second at Section 7 across from the escalator. On the Upper Concourse, on the fourth floor of the arena, an ATM is located at Section 216 across from the ABSOLUT Vegas Lounge. Finally, prior to entering T-Mobile Arena, two ATMs are located outside between the main doors and the Box Office.

T-Mobile Arena is committed to creating a safe, comfortable and enjoyable entertainment experience. Guests have a right to expect an environment where:

Guests will be treated in a consistent, professional and courteous manner by all venue personnel.

Guests will enjoy every event free from disruptive behavior, including foul or abusive language or obscene gestures.

Guests will consume alcoholic beverages in a responsible manner. Intervention with an impaired, intoxicated or underage guest will be handled in a prompt and safe manner.

Guests will sit only in their ticketed seats or suites and show their tickets when requested.

Guests who engage in fighting, throwing objects or attempting to enter the court/stage will be immediately ejected from the venue.

Guests are not permitted to smoke in the venue. T-Mobile Arena is a non-smoking venue and property. Additionally, the immediate area around the arena is also non-smoking.

Guests will not display any obscene or indecent messages on signs or clothing.

Guests will comply with requests from venue staff regarding facility operations and emergency response procedures.

Guests will also be responsible for their own good time by reporting inappropriate behavior.

Guests will be required to wear a shirt and shoes at all times for their own safety. T-Mobile Arena management reserves the right to deny entry to guests wearing clothing items or signs displaying offensive text and/or images.

Guests will be able to communicate instantly, discreetly and directly with T-Mobile Arena's Security Command Center if assistance is needed in dealing with an unruly fan, a cleanup in their section or any issues and concerns that a guest may feel the need to report. The In Stadium Solutions (24/7) text system number is present throughout the venue for fans to access.

The Arena staff has been trained to intervene where necessary to help ensure that the above expectations are met, and guests are encouraged to report any inappropriate behavior to the nearest usher, security guard, guest services staff member or anonymously through our texting system.

Guests who do not adhere to the above code of conduct will be subject to ejection without refund, and may also be in violation of city ordinances resulting in possible arrest and prosecution. Season ticket holders are also subject to having their season subscription revoked. Thank you for your cooperation.

Feel like a VIP when you arrive at T-Mobile Arena and purchase expedited entry. The Dash Pass gives you access to an exclusive entrance line so you won't have to wait to start your experience. Dash Pass expedited entry is located at the West Suite Entrance of the arena, off of Park Avenue.

Please note: Guests must purchase a show ticket to purchase a T-Mobile Arena Dash Pass. One (1) T-Mobile Arena Dash Pass allows one (1) guest expedited entry ONLY. Each guest in the party will need to purchase a T-Mobile Arena Dash Pass to access the dedicated entrance line.

All questions can be directed to the Box Office at 702.692.1616

T-Mobile Arena is committed to creating a safe, comfortable and enjoyable entertainment experience for all our guests. We require all guests to maintain reasonable and appropriate behavior at all times. Guests using offensive language or engaging in disorderly conduct may be ejected from the facility and may be subject to arrest. Ejected guests will not receive a refund for their tickets or be compensated in any way for their loss.

The following are what guests can expect when visiting T-Mobile Arena:

Guests will be treated in a consistent, professional and courteous manner by all venue personnel

Guests will enjoy every event free from disruptive behavior, including foul or abusive language or obscene gestures

Guests will consume alcoholic beverages in a responsible manner. Intervention with an impaired, intoxicated or underage guest will be handled in a prompt and safe manner

Guests will sit only in their ticketed seats or suites and show their tickets when requested

The following behavior may result in a guests removal from the arena:

Guests who enter the playing area or stage will be immediately ejected from the venue

Guests who smoke in the venue. T-Mobile Arena is a non-smoking facility

Guests who use any obscene or indecent messages on signs or clothing

Guests who do not comply with requests from venue staff regarding facility operations and emergency response procedures

Guests who stand on chairs, railings or put other guests on their backs or shoulders

Guests who are fighting or challenge others to a fight

Guests who “moon” or show other private body parts will be escorted out of the venue

Guests who violate any of T-Mobile Arena’s policies and procedures

Guests who violate any local, state or federal laws or statutes

Guests who ignite any display of flames, i.e. lighters, matches

Guests who attempt to enter any backstage areas without permission

Guests who throw, discharge, or launch any object or liquid substance

Guests who willfully and maliciously disturb another guest/employee with loud and unreasonable noise

Guests who use profanity and/or offensive words, which are likely to provoke a violent reaction from others

Guests who taunt or use offensive language against any players, referees, or performers

The Arena staff has been trained to intervene where necessary to help ensure that the above expectations are met, and guests are encouraged to report any inappropriate behavior to the nearest usher, security guard, guest services staff member or anonymously through our texting system

Guests who choose not to adhere to the above code of conduct will be subject to ejection without refund, and may also be in violation of city ordinances resulting in possible arrest and prosecution. Thank you for your cooperation.

T-Mobile Arena continually works with the Las Vegas Fire Department, the Las Vegas Police Department, and other agencies in the development of specific Emergency Procedures Plans for each event. T-Mobile Arena's goal is to provide a safe and enjoyable atmosphere by using installed automated security systems and appropriate security operating plans. Trained Guest Services and Security personnel will ensure the security and safety of all guests, performers, employees and occupants of T-Mobile Arena. In the case of an emergency, guests must comply with directives from venue staff regarding arena operations and emergency response procedures.

T-Mobile Arena’s Main Entrance is located on the northeast side of the building facing Toshiba Plaza, across from Park MGM and behind New York-New York Hotel Casino.

T-Mobile Fast Pass Entrance is located at the Main Entrance at the first door to the right side opposite the Box Office.

Access to the Suite Level can be found via the bridge on the fourth level of the New York-New York Hotel Casino parking garage. Additionally, Suite Holders can also utilize the Suite Lobbies on both the East and West sides of the arena. Guests will need a Premium Level ticket to access these entrances.

Our VIP entrances can be found on both the East and West sides of the arena. Club and Event Membership ticket holders may utilize these entrances.

Also hidden away beneath the lower bowl are eight destination suites – four on each side of the arena – to entertain guests within an ultra-elite environment. Built adjacent to the athletes’ entrance to the event floor, these 700-square-foot bunker suites are fully furnished with a premium TV with in-house and satellite programming as well as a private bar and restroom. Owners of Event Level Suites will be given 16 premium lower-level seats to all public arena events, as well as eight additional passes for guests to enjoy the suite experience.

T-Mobile Arena has three family restrooms located on the Main Concourse. They are located close to the First Aid Room by Section 3, next to the Main Guest Service Center by Section 13, and across from Section 19. Additionally, there are two family restrooms located on the Upper Concourse, one by Section 209 on the east side and one by Section 219 on the west side. Family Restrooms are equipped with baby changing tables.

Trained Emergency Medical Technicians (EMT) are available to assist any guest in need at every T-Mobile Arena event. The primary First Aid is located on the Main Concourse behind Section 2 while a secondary location is on the Upper Concourse near Section 202. Additionally, the EMT’s are mobile and can come to any location in the arena.

In addition, T-Mobile Arena is equipped with Automatic External Defibrillators (AED). Designated employees, including our EMT staff, have been properly trained and certified to use the AED. In the event of a medical emergency, contact a member of our Guest Services or Security staff for assistance. These devices are located at both of the First Aid locations.

The General Admission area, located on the floor of the arena, is standing room only as there are no seats. Guests wishing to arrive early are encouraged to line-up no earlier than 4 p.m. Doors will open at the same time for all guests. After entering the building, all guests with GA Floor tickets will receive a wristband to access the floor and will be directed to select aisles that have access to the floor.

T-Mobile Arena is dedicated to helping protect our planet. By integrating a comprehensive sustainability program, we are able to reduce carbon footprint, while continuing to provide our guests with a superior experience.

We believe that a greener business is a better business, and through our actions, we can have a positive impact on our visitors, communities, and the planet. Our goal is to make a difference that will last for generations.

T-Mobile arena has two Guest Services Centers. The Main Guest Services Center is located on the Main Concourse behind section 13. Our second Guest Service Center is on the Upper Concourse by section 216.

These Guest Services Centers are intended to assist our guests in regards to event information, questions, concerns, or issues during T-Mobile Arena events. In addition, the Guest Services Centers serve to assist guests with disabilities with any inquiries or accessibility information for each event. For any advanced inquiries, please contact guestservices@tmobilearena.com.

Hyde Lounge at T-Mobile Arena is located in the center of the Tower Club on the 5th floor and is open to all guests, with the exception of private events. This area offers a unique nightclub atmosphere boasting 18,000 square feet of exclusive space perched more than 100 feet above the arena floor. Guests can access this area via the West VIP/Suite Elevators and welcome to guests aged 21 and above.

The disruptor in defining the sports and entertainment hospitality experience, Levy is recognized as the market leader and most critically acclaimed hospitality company in its industry. Twice named one of the 10 most innovative companies in sports by Fast Company magazine and one of the top three Best Employers for Diversity in America by Forbes, Levy's diverse portfolio includes award-winning restaurants; iconic sports and entertainment venues, zoos and cultural institutions, theaters, and convention centers; as well as the Super Bowl, Grammy Awards, PGA Championship, US Open Tennis Tournament, Kentucky Derby, and NHL, MLB, NBA, NFL, and MLS All-Star Games.

For guests looking for a private experience, look no further than the arena loge boxes. These deluxe seats will range in size to comfortably fit four-to-six guests and will be perfectly situated in one end of the lower level at the opposite end of the stage for viewing concerts. Loge Box owners will receive tickets to all public events at T-Mobile Arena while enjoying in-seating perks such as drink service, individual TV displays for every two seats at the table, and access to a private VIP lounge.

Lost children/guests should be directed to any one of our Guest Services Centers, located on the Main Concourse and the Upper Concourse. Parents looking for a lost child should contact the nearest Usher or Security Officer. For safety reasons T-Mobile Arena is unable to make in-arena announcements for lost children or guests.

Give a detailed description of the person(s) in question including:

Name

Location of area last seen

Age/Race/Sex

Eye and hair color

Height/weight/build

Description of clothes including shoes

Any distinguished characteristics

All Lost & Found items are to be turned into the Main Guest Service Center on the Main Concourse as soon as possible. Any guest looking for a Lost & Found item during the event should be directed to that location.

Guests inquiring about Lost & Found items post-event should inquire about picking up items that were turned in by filling out this form.

T-Mobile Arena assumes no responsibility for lost items at any event.

Positioned around the arena to offer prime views of the event floor, these 310-square-foot suites offer a home-style experience within the arena including swank amenities such as sofa-style seating, a private bar with a large screen TV, as well as a personal refrigerator and ice machine. Owners of these luxurious spaces receive 12 tickets to all public events at T-Mobile Arena with the opportunity to purchase four additional tickets for bar stool seating within the suite. All luxury suite owners and their guests make their way into the arena via exclusive VIP entrances and also have access to multiple VIP lounges and clubs.

There are many options for parking for events at T-Mobile Arena. We encourage guests to make a plan, come early and stay late. Depending on the experience you're looking for the night of the event there are a variety of parking options. Visit our parking page for more details.

Reserved Event Parking for T-Mobile Arena is available at the following locations:

New York-New York (VIP and Reserved Event Parking)

Aria Garage (Reserved Event Parking)

Park MGM Garage (Reserved Event Parking)

To purchase Reserved Event Parking, please click here.

For safety purposes, all guests entering T-Mobile Arena will be searched and have their belongings scanned. T-Mobile Arena reserves the right to confiscate items which may cause danger or disruption to the event or other guests, or which are in breach of building policies and/or prohibited items. Any guest who declines to be searched may be denied entry or ejected from T-Mobile Arena.

The If You See Something, Say Something™ campaign is a simple and effective program to engage the public and key frontline employees in identifying and reporting indicators of terrorism, crime and other threats to the proper transportation and law enforcement authorities.

If you see something, say something! To report suspicious activity, see your nearest Usher or Security Officer, or call 1-877-A-THREAT (1-877-284-7328).

T-Mobile Arena has partnered with nonprofit organization KultureCity to introduce two sensory pods. Designed by medical professionals, the rooms provide a dedicated space for those who may need a quieter and more secure environment. The sensory pods are outfitted with Yogibo bean bags, visual light panels by Nanoleaf, activity panels and bubble walls.

The sensory pods are located on the main concourse near section 13 and upper concourse near section 216. Sensory Pods will be open for all events taking place at T-Mobile Arena.

Guests are not encouraged to bring strollers into the arena. Strollers are not permitted in the seating sections due to potential safety hazards, however; strollers may be checked into our Main Guest Services Center, located on the Main Concourse by Section 13 or at our Guest Services Center, located on the Upper Concourse by Section 216. Strollers are allowed in suites.

Terrace Tables provide patrons an assigned table elevated above the lower bowl for unique views of the action. Up to four ticketed guests can enjoy all the perks of going to a bar, while actually being at the event, including in-seat drink service, TV displays and an option for personalized catering from a nearby VIP lounge.

A new shopping experience with Just Walk Out technology by Amazon.

1. Enter with credit card 2. Grab what you want 3 Go and Enjoy!

Located on Main Concourse Section 9 and Section 13

The Park is the public area located south of the New York-New York Hotel Casino on the corner of Las Vegas Boulevard and Park Avenue.

The Park is an immersive, outdoor destination for dining and entertainment. An eclectic blend of restaurants, bars and entertainment make this the pulse that combines New York-New York, Park MGM and T-Mobile Arena into one community. All of the venues are outfitted with outdoor patio seating to make everyone feel like they are part of the action. The art and horticulture programs for The Park are inspired by the desert landscape, which creates a vibrant and unique ambiance that is unlike anything else on The Strip.

Restaurants located in The Park include:

Beerhaus

Shake Shack

Hello Kitty Cafe

To avoid disputes with counterfeit, stolen or voided tickets, guests should make all ticketing purchases through authorized outlets only. Authorized outlets include www.t-mobilearena.com, T-Mobile Arena Box Office, www.axs.com, AXS Charge by Phone, and MGM Resorts International Ticket Offices or Concierge Locations. T-Mobile Arena will not be responsible for validating tickets that were not purchased through an authorized outlet.

Toshiba Plaza is the area just outside T-Mobile Arena’s Main Doors.

Toshiba Plaza provides two acres of entertainment activation space. With three stages including the Mezzanine Stage attached to T-Mobile Arena, Toshiba Plaza is perfect for fan fests, sponsorship activations, outdoor concerts and TV broadcasts. Measuring 175 feet wide and 45 feet high, the LED media mesh on the side of T-Mobile Arena not only provides advertising space but also an opportunity to show sporting events, movies and premiers. Toshiba Plaza connects to The Park, NY-NY and Park MGM, which provides guests with opportunities for dining and entertainment pre- and post- event.

For information about booking an event in our Toshiba Plaza please visit our website.

For parents who prefer private feeding locations for their babies they may use the UMC Lactation Suites at T-Mobile Arena. Each Suite is powered with interior dual plug outlets, interior lighting, a USB port, seating and some additional supplies. Lactation Suites are located near sections 13 on the main concourse and 216 on the upper concourse. For access to the UMC Lactation Suites or questions, please visit the Guest Services desks.

Guests, including law enforcement personnel not present in an official capacity, are prohibited from bringing weapons into the arena. T-Mobile Arena does not provide weapon lockers and will not check in weapons at Guest Services. Weapons include, but are not limited to, the following: firearms, explosives, stun guns, handcuffs, brass knuckles, sticks, clubs, batons, martial arts instruments, pepper spray, tear gas, knives, etc. Guests found in possession of the above-mentioned items will be asked to remove the item from the arena or dispose of it. Guests who refuse to comply will be ejected from the arena and may be subject to arrest.

T-Mobile Arena utilizes mobile delivery of tickets. Will Call services may be available for select events. Tickets arranged for Will Call may only be picked up by the account holder whose name is on the account. A current, valid government-issued ID and credit card used to purchase tickets are required for pick-up.

Lost or Stolen Tickets: If tickets are lost or stolen, tickets can be reprinted under the following guidelines: Original purchaser must show a valid photo ID and credit card used to purchase at the venue box office and pay reprint fee. No reprints can be made on cash purchases.

Door opening times for T-Mobile Arena events will vary by event.
